content.content: Falls are the most frequently reported adult adverse event in US hospitals [^98] ![fall out of bed](//images.ctfassets.net/xbvvg00rroa3/wJZBv2QU06eKcLp05Emvd/4ba0dd3d8e36aaac13128f6421b8039b/fall_out_of_bed.jpg) About 11,000 hospital patients die from falls in the US every year.[^99] ### Prevention: Embedded content: https://youtu.be/MhPFCRLevY0 1\. Have someone with the patient 24/7. Don’t leave the patient alone if they are at risk for a fall.[^7] Embedded content: https://youtu.be/GvX0AYUqeI0?list=LL31GglpqkW9B1NW8eHUZ-CA 2\. Call for help before getting out of bed. Use your call light. __Don’t walk if you feel dizzy, sleepy or not yourself.__[^7] ![Call light](//images.ctfassets.net/xbvvg00rroa3/4CdrMBsvYQemEkGW06AAqk/6bf5524a457e19aba2aeff90f846e5cc/Call_light.jpg) 3\. Mobilize the patient safely as soon as the doctor permits. Wear non-slip slippers or shoes that fit well. Clear obstacles in the room if you or your loved one wants to walk to the bathroom. Make sure an assistive device like a walker or cane is available for the patient to use if needed.[^7] ![walkers](https://cdn2.hubspot.net/hub/114266/file-16410688-png/images/c--documents_and_settings-ninar-desktop-walkers_and_assistive_devices_sm.png) 4\. Take off your slippers worn over socks before getting back to bed, since they can pick up germs on the floor.[^7] Embedded content: https://youtu.be/tx3Oc0SIZnI __Use the Hospital Plan of Care form to advocate and ask questions about your loved one.__ [The Hospital Plan of Care form](https://patientsafetymovement.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/POC-Blank-April-19.pdf "The Hospital Plan of Care form") [Guide to Medical Care at a Distance](https://patientsafetymovement.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Guide-to-Medical-Care-at-a-Distance.pdf "Guide to Medical Care at a Distance") [Falls](https://www.nlm.nih.gov/medlineplus/falls.html) [Making the World Safer for Senior Citizens by Senior Living](https://www.seniorliving.org/research/injury-prevention-guide/ "Making the World Safer for Senior Citizens by Senior Living") [^7]: Hallisey J. The Empowered Patient® hospital guide for patients and families. Empowered Patient website. http://engagedpatients.org/wp-content/uploads/2014/06/empowered_patient_hospital_guide.pdf. Published 2009. Updated 2012. Accessed May 10, 2015. [^98]: Brown CJ, Friedkin RJ, Inouye SK. Prevalence and outcomes of low mobility in hospitalized older patients. *J Am Geriatr Soc* 2004 Aug;52(8):1263-70. doi: 10.1111/j.1532-5415.2004.52354.x Accessed on November 3, 2020 [^99]: Currie LM, Fall and injury prevention. Patient Safety & Quality, An Evidence-based Handbook for Nurses. Rochelle, MD: Agency for Healthcare Research & Quality; 2008:195-250.
